comments: John, are you planning to provide a bug description/error log/build information?

Some how I hit enter earlier than I should.
Sorry.

No problem, I just wanted to make sure you were aware.

What Eclipse build are you using to develop? What Eclipse build is in your target?
I am using RC1 as host as well as target.

Are you sure your dev is RC1? Note that the org.eclipse.sdk.ide product did not
exist in 3.1 RC1 and is the default product in 3.1 RC2. If you were using RC2 to
develop and targetting an older build that did not have this product, you would
need to manually change the product to run (in the launch configuration dialog)
to be org.eclipse.platform.ide. Could you confirm that is not your problem?

OK. I should hold back a little bit. I am sure I am using RC1 as my dev hosting
env, but I am not sure my target if it is using RC2. I will find out. If I am
using RC2 in my target should I use RC2 as my dev hosting too?

I guess you are right, the default product is obtained from the target. Though
it might work otherwise, the supported scenario is "dev >= target".

Clarifying: yes, if target is RC2, you are forced to use RC2 (or a more recent
build, if there was one) as your development environment.

Just got confirm back from build, that we don't use RC2 yet. So I can confirm
that I use RC1 as my hosing  dev env and use RC1 as my target.

Sorry, one more thing, it does not looks like we are using RC1 in my target, but
not RC2 yest. So it may be something between. So you are right I might have
problem using RC1 as hosting, so I will try to use RC2 as my hosting and see.
After I use RC2 as my host, it works.

Moving to PDE to decide if there is anything we can do to help users to diagnose
the problem (dev "older" than target).

I hope we could do something about it. When I got could not find application id,
and start to look into the problem, I do a search I could not find anything. I
think at least we should have some form of notes that I can search, that will
help  a lot. Instead of going through opening bugzilla process.

No forward compatibility.  Host must always be >= target.
Much like you can't expect to use 3.0 to target 3.1 for example.

Wassim, that is understood and accepted. What is being requested is a way for
users to be warned about the problem or doc or a readme entry.
I still think it should provide some warning or document for it. Close it.

traces.message: No application id has been found.
